intro: Senecio halleri, commonly known as the Haller's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually hairy and serrated. Senecio halleri is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance and hardy nature.
